TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Signature

Docs.summary: This type is a wrapper for a COM interface implemented by a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. To access the members specified by this interface, use the type that wraps the coclass that implements this interface. For information about that type, including usage, remarks, and examples, see.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Certificate As CertificateObject

Docs.summary: Gets the object for the X.509 digital certificate that was used to sign a form or a set of signed data in a form.

example.para: In the following example, the Certificate property of the object is used to access the certificate of the digital signature, and display the property of the object in a message box:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Comment As String
public: property System::String ^ Comment { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the text comment that was added to the digital signature associated with a form or a set of signed data in a form.

example.para: In the following example, the Comment property of the object is displayed in a message box:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Sign() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Writes the XML digital signature block and computes the cryptographic hash for the signed data.

remarks.para: The Sign method can only be called from the event. Calling this method advances the Digital Signatures Wizard to the second step in the signing process, selecting a certificate.

example.para: In the following example, created by adding the event to the form by selecting Programming from the Tools menu in the InfoPath designer user interface, a digital signature is added to the form by using the Sign method of the object:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SignatureBlockXmlNode As IXMLDOMNode

Docs.summary: Gets the XML node corresponding a digital signature.

example.para: In the following example, the XML of the SignatureBlockXmlNode property of the object is displayed in a message box:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Status As XdSignatureStatus

Docs.summary: Gets the status of the specified digital signature.

remarks.para: The status that is returned is based on the enumeration.

The Status property only verifies whether the hash of the digital signature is valid. It does not verify the chain of trust of the digital certificate, nor does it verify that the image of the view captured at the time the signature was added matches the current view of the signed form.

example.para: In the following example, the property of the Signature object is used to determine the status of the signature, and is displayed in a message box:
